title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.3-4 Part 1 | 18-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञानति मिरान दस्या ज्ञानां जनिशलाकया चक्षुरुन मीलितं येना तस्वैं श्री गुरवे नमहा
नमा ओम विष्टु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाया भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदांत स्वामिल नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पास्चात्य देशतारिने
जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानंदा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा शिवास अधी गौरवक्त वृंदा
हरे कृष्ण हरे राम हरे रामा रामा रामा हरे हरे
ओम्नमा भगवते वासु देवाया नारायनम नमस्कृत्या नरम चैवनरोत्तमं
देवीं सरस्वतीं व्यासम ततो जयमुदी ररेत
in this session we will be discussing from the third and fourth verses of the 13th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam since there is a long purport for these two verses
given by Srila Prabhupada we will discuss this in two parts so this session will be discussing
part one of the purport so the third and fourth verses are given together I shall read them
together
so the third and fourth verses are given together their translation
when they saw Vidura return to the palace all the inhabitants
Maharaj Yudhishthira, his younger brothers, Dhritarashtra, Satyaki, Sanjaya, Kripacharya,
Kunti, Gandhari, Draupadi, Subhadra, Uttara, Kripi, many other wives of the Kauravas
and other ladies with children all hurried to him in great delight
it so appeared that they had regained their consciousness after a long period
this indicates how dear Vidura was to all the inhabitants of the palace of Hastinapura
foolishly Duryodhana insulted Vidura though Vidura was a well wisher of Dhritarashtra and all the Kauravas
but Duryodhana he very foolishly in a narrow minded way
he thought somehow that Vidura was against his real welfare
while the opposite was true Vidura was actually advising Dhritarashtra
for the well being of Dhritarashtra and their entire family members
but Duryodhana thought otherwise and when Duryodhana out of foolishness he insulted Vidura
Vidura left the palace and went away not because exactly that he was insulted by Duryodhana
but because he was not interested in any material comforts or materialistic way of life
his interest was in Krishna consciousness and he thought it wise to go on a pilgrimage
and travel to holy places searching for a suitable pure devotee of the Lord
to hear Krishna katha and inquire about spirituality
from such a bonafide proper devotee
so it was described in the previous words that Vidura was on pilgrimage
he actually went searching for a pure devotee
he came in contact with Maitriya Muni
he inquired from Maitriya Muni
and after he got conviction that the ultimate goal is to be established in transcendental loving service of the Supreme Lord Krishna
after that he stopped putting questions to Maitriya and returned to Hastinapura
now what are the purpose of return to Hastinapura that will be made clear in the next few verses
but here when he returned
all the inhabitants of Hastinapura were not the same as he had been in the past
also that palace
Maharaj Yudhishthira, the brothers of Yudhishthira
Kunti, Gandhari, Draupadi
and so many other ladies with children
all of them they were very very joyful to receive him back after he had left and gone
means they were not happy that he left
Duryodhana foolishly insulted Vidura
but Vidura was actually a real well wisher
and he was very dear to all the other members of the family
so they all felt great delight when Vidura returned
and they went to receive him
and they were appearing to have regained their consciousness after a long time
it appeared like that
they were so happy, so joyful
so Srila Prabhupada in the Purport describes
the four different personalities mentioned in this verse
the brief history of Gandhari
Kunti
Draupadi
and Subhadra
these four personalities history
brief history is given by Srila Prabhupada in the Purport
so first of all Prabhupada describes the history of Gandhari
Gandhari is the mother of the Kauravas
she is the wife of Tirtharashtra
and she is being described here
by Srila Prabhupada
the ideal chaste lady in the history of the world
such a glorious description of Gandhari
ideal chaste lady
now why she is described in this way
will be very clear in the later parts of this description
she was the daughter of Maharaj Subala
the king of Gandhara
now this Gandhara is known as
Kandahar in Kabul, Afghanistan
and in her maiden state
Gandhari worshipped Lord Shiva
Lord Shiva is generally worshipped by Hindu maidens
to get a good husband
Gandhari satisfied Lord Shiva
and by his benediction
to obtain 100 sons
she was betrothed to Tirtharashtra
despite his being blind forever
Tirtharashtra was very powerful Kshatriya
but he had that blindness from birth
he was born blind
when Gandhari came to know
that her would-be husband was a blind man
to follow her life companion
she decided to become voluntarily blind
these are the characteristics of a chaste lady
a chaste wife
she voluntarily decided to become blind
so what did she do
she wrapped up her eyes with many silk linens
and she was married to Tirtharashtra
under the guidance of her elder brother Shakuni
she was the most beautiful girl of her time
and she was equally qualified by her
by her womanly qualities
which endeared every member of the Kaurava court
despite all her good qualities
she had the natural frailties of a woman
and she was envious of Kunti
when the latter gave birth to a male child
both the queens were pregnant
but Kunti first gave birth to a male child
thus Gandhari became angry
and gave a blow to her own abdomen
as a result she gave birth to a lump of flesh only
but since she was a devotee of Vyasadeva
by the instruction of Vyasadeva
the lump was divided into 100 parts
and each part gradually developed to become a male child
thus her ambition to become the mother of 100 sons
was fulfilled
and she began to nourish all the children
according to her exalted position
when the intrigue of the battle of Kurukshetra was going on
she was not in favour of fighting with the Pandavas
rather she blamed Dhritarashtra
her husband
for such a fratricidal war
she desired
that the state be divided into two parts
from the sons of Pandu and her own sons
she was very affected by this
when all her sons died in the battle of Kurukshetra
and she wanted to curse Bhishmadeva
and Yudhishthira
but she was checked by Vyasadeva
so you can understand
she is a very chaste lady
she is very faithful to her husband
but still she
advised based on proper religious principles
and she actually felt grief
when she lost all her 100 sons
in the battle of Kurukshetra
her mourning over the death of Duryodhana and Dushasana
before Lord Krishna was very pitiful
and Lord Krishna pacified her
by transcendental messages
always in the Vedic culture
when somebody is agreed due to the death of a near and dear one
they are pacified
by transcendental messages from the Vedic literature
that is the only way one can become pacified
further it is described by Srila Prabhupada
she was equally agreed on the death of Karna
and she described to Lord Krishna
the lamentation of Karna's wife
she was pacified by Shri Vyasadeva
when he showed her dead sons
then promoted to the heavenly kingdom
she died along with her husband
in the jungles of the Himalayas
near the mouth of the Ganges
she burned in a forest fire
Maharaj Yudhishthira performed the death ceremony
of his uncle and aunt
then Srila Prabhupada describes
Kunti Devi's brief history
Kunti Devi was born as the daughter of Maharaj Shurasena
and she was a sister of Vasudeva
Vasudeva was Lord Krishna's father
later Kunti
was adopted by Maharaj Kunti Bhoja
and hence she is known as Kunti
she was born as the daughter of Maharaj Shurasena
but she was adopted by Kunti Bhoja
and therefore she is called Kunti
she is the incarnation of the success potency
of the personality
you got it
the heavenly denizens used
from the upper planets
used to visit the palace of King Kunti Bhoja
and Kunti was engaged for their reception
in former times people were very pious
that the pious people of the earth
were very strict in following all the rules and regulations
so they
were visited by the devatas
and devatas were visible on this earth planet
whenever they used to visit here
because people were pious
in Kali Yuga because of the sinful activities
having increased too much
we cannot see the devatas
even when they come to this material world
now whenever these heavenly denizens used to visit King Kunti Bhoja's palace
Kunti was engaged for their reception
she also happened to serve the great mystic sage
Durvasa Muni
and being satisfied by her faithful service
Durvasa Muni gave her a mantra
by which it was possible
for her
to call any devata she pleased
as a matter of inquisitiveness
she at once called for the sun god
Suryadeva
now this Suryadeva
when he was called
he immediately desired couplement with her
but she declined
but the sun god assured her
that
she would be
not adulterated
her virginity would not be adulterated
that she would be given immunity from the adulteration
of her virginity
so she agreed to that proposal
as a result
of this couplement
she became pregnant
and Karna was born by her
this is before her marriage
to Pandu
so by the grace
of the sun
she again turned into
a virgin girl
but being afraid of her parents
she
quitted the newly born child Karna
after that
when she actually selected
her own husband
she preferred Pandu to be her husband
now
Pandu was
under a curse
that he could not conceive children
from his wife
Kunti
so therefore
Kunti had to use that mantra
to call upon devatas
to bear children for Pandu
and that's how
the five Pandavas
sorry the three
first three Pandavas
were born from Kunti
and two other Pandavas
were born from Madri
so there is
more description
which we will
continue to discuss
in the next session
I will stop here
thank you very much
Hare Krishna
